sub_title: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum
summary:
My professional experience links wide-range scholarship, incorporating art history, history and cultural philosophy, with creative and reliable management for museums and exhibitions. I like challenges, getting results even under difficult circumstances. My strength is my capability to encourage teams to get more and better results through collaboration, starting from clearly-expressed directions and goals.
My own goal is to keep on developing my experience in directing people within museums, in collaboration with all kind of stakeholders, most of all the museum public.

Specialties: directing people through collaboration, focused on results by means of creative efficiency, generating concepts and scenarios for museums, exhibitions and city art projects, producing exhibitions, (art)historical shifts and margins, anchored instead of autonomous creative developments

awards.title: Langman Prijs 2021
awards.description:
De Langman Prijs 2021 is toegekend aan het Drents, Fries en Groninger Museum. Dit is dinsdagavond middels een video bekend gemaakt. De drie directeuren namen de prijs in ontvangst van juryvoorzitter Jouke de Vries, bestuursvoorzitter Rijksuniversiteit Groningen. Normaliter wordt de prijs uitgereikt tijdens de Nieuwjaarsreceptie Noord-Nederland, een bijeenkomst waar circa 900 ondernemers en bestuurders aanwezig zijn.
De Langman Prijs wordt uitgereikt aan een persoon of instantie die grenzeloos denkt, handelt, bestuurt, onderneemt en daarmee impulsen geeft aan de noordelijke opinievorming en/of economische ontwikkeling. De prijs is voor de eerste keer toegekend aan drie individuele instanties die gezamenlijk een stevige bijdrage hebben geleverd aan het welzijn in Noord-Nederland.

awards.title: Global Fine Art Award 2018 for the exhibition on Alma Tadema (2016-2017)
awards.description: The exhibition of 80 works featuring classical scenes by the Frisian artist (Sit Lawrence Alma-Tadema (1936-1912) drew a record 158,000 visitors to the Fries Museum. In 2017 it traveled to the Unteres Belvedere in Vienna and Leighton House Museum in London.

projects.title: Princessehof transition storage space
projects.description: With the completion of the relocation of the depot collections to the off-site Friesland Collection Centre, the Princessehof site itself will get a transition storage space, to facilitate incoming and outgoing collections and loans.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: EKWC@Princessehof: Meekyoung Shin
projects.description: The exhibition is devoted to new work by Meekyoung Shin (South Korea, 1967), in which she explores the boundaries between nature and art. Her new Megalith Series was inspired by the creation of stone from clay. Shin made the work during an artist’s residency at sundaymorning@ekwc in Oisterwijk, the Netherlands.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: Morten Løbner Mortensen: Frobidden fruit
projects.description: The ceramics of Morten Løbner Espersen (Aalborg, 1965) are characterised by the tension between shape and surface. In addition, Espersen searches for the limits of glazing techniques. In his solo exhibition Forbidden Fruit in the Princessehof he experiments with vivid glazes to highlight their textures and exuberant colours. This exhibition runs parallel to Espersens show at the Kunstmuseum in The Hague.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: Korea: Gateway to a rich past
projects.description: The exhibition unravels the country's rich past and ancient culture on the basis of themes such as food culture, beauty ideals and rituals. Top pieces from the National Museum of Korea in Seoul will be brought to Leeuwarden especially for the exhibition. This is the first time they will be exhibited in the Netherlands. The exhibition includes precious jade-green celadon, pure white porcelain and ancient pottery, functional items such as musical instruments, as well as film footage and costumes. Contemporary work by Korean artists confirm that ceramics still play an important role in Korea today. In close collaboration with the National Museum of Korea.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: Yoon Seok-Hyeon: Ott / Another paradigmatic ceramic
projects.description: Glazed ceramics are generally not recyclable and usually end up in landfills. In his search for a sustainable alternative to toxic glazing, Yoon Seok-Hyeon (South-Korea 1992) came across an ancient technique from his native country, ‘Ott’. The wood resin from the lacquer tree is traditionally used in Korea to lacquer wooden utensils. Yoon applies the technique (also called ‘Ottchil’) to ceramics. His Ottchil lacquered bowls, vases and dishes can be seen in this solo exhibition, which also provides the visitor with an insight into his working process.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: Son-et-lumière Maria Louise was here
projects.description: The Princessehof presented the event Marie Louise was here during the summer of 2021. For eight weeks from 9 July 2021, visitors could congregate in the palace garden late on Thursday, Friday and Saturday evenings for a poetic Son et lumière that combined film, music and light. A Corona-proof open-air event in the historic heart of Leeuwarden. A reprise is scheduled for August-October 2022.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: Taus Makhacheva: It's possible to raise the ceiling a bit
projects.description: The Fries Museum in Leeuwarden exhibited works by Taus Makhacheva (Moscow, 1983) . The majority of the works in this extensive solo exhibition were on view in the Netherlands for the first time. The exhibition included a living archive by The Unbound collective, and films, objects, installations and new work she made especially for the Fries Museum. The exhibition explored the traditions of history making and its encounters with everyday life.

contributors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

projects.title: Maria Louise, princess of Orange-Nassau
projects.description: The Princessehof city palace in the historic city centre owes its name to the ancestor of our current royal family: Marie Louise of Hesse-Kassel, Princess of Orange-Nassau. An intimate exhibition draws back the curtain on her eventful life. Portraits, prints, drawings and an Orange family tree show that Marie Louise was crucial to preserving the Orange Dynasty. The exhibition will become a permanent feature at the museum. This, in combination with the renewed Escher exhibition, will highlight the Princessehof’s fascinating history.

projects.title: Moving the collections
projects.description: There are 240,000 objects in the care of the Fries Museum: heritage from Roman times to the Middle Ages, art until 1900, applied arts like textiles, furniture, silver and glass, the collection of the Frisian Resistance Museum and modern and contemporary art. From March 2016 to December 2020 we move the collection to the new energy neutral museum depot. At the same time, we separate the wheat from the chaff, and make diigital photos of every object. (Collection online in Dutch.) This enhances the visibility of the entire collection and its use by the Fries Museum itself but also by other heritage institutes. At any given time, objects from the collections are on display at over 100 locations. In 2021 also the collection of the Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics, 34,000 objects of European and Asian ceramics including contemporary pieces, will be transferred to the new depot.

projects.title: Kranen/Gille - Combers Cabinet 2015
projects.description: Invited by the Zuiderzee Museum, designer duo Kranen/Gille elaborated on keeping collections, connection the outdoor museum's props to their their MECK lamps for Cor Unum. The project is an hommage to the invaluable 'worthless' object we cherish as relics of our experiences.

projects.title: Zuiderzee Museum Collection Information Policy 2014-2020
projects.description: The Zuiderzee Museum will play a regional service role in the data layer of the national digital heritage infrastructure. By making collections jointly accessible on a (inter)national level, the Zuiderzee Museum shifts from merely being the keeper of a part of the heritage to a dynamic crossroads making data available that is Created Once but that can be Published Everywhere (COPE).

projects.title: rENs - Mourning Materialized 2013
projects.description: rENs, the design duo Renee Mennen en Stefanie van Keijsteren, elaborated their ROOD (Red) project for the Zuiderzee Museum into textiles showing lifelines of individual women around the Zuiderzee, with bands of colour representing their periods of mourning. Lisa Klappe made the accompanying film and photograph.

projects.title: Glithero - Made to Measure 2013
projects.description: Commissioned by the Zuiderzee Museum, Studio Glithero created a series of textiles and an accompanying film about the intangible heritage of tradition crafts, closely linked to the individual craftsmen. The series Made to Measure is a collaboration with the Textile Museum in Tilburg and the Museum Speelklok (on self-playing instruments) in Utrecht. Studio Glithero also designed the exhibition.

projects.description: While we focused more on the eastern part of the Zuiderzee region, this exhibition was the first exploration of costumes in the IJssel delta region. The exhibition was only possible with the help of fabulous private collections. Curated by Erik Walsmit, designed by Berry van gerwen, produced by Femke van Drongelen.

projects.title: Industrious|Artefacts - The evolution of crafts 2011
projects.description: On the occasion of the year of the crafts, the first of a cycle of five years devoted to the central topics of the Zuiderzee Museum, Studio Makkink & Bey curated and designed an exhibition about new possiblities alongside the museum as a living library. Powerful graphic design by Hansje van Halem, light design by Henk van der Geest. For the collection of the museum, Makkink and Bey was assisted by André Groeneveld. In the open air museum, design students of the Sandberg  Institute of lived, worked and presented new work. Alongside the exhibition, the Premsela Institute organised a symposium. Produced by Femke van Drongelen.

authors.headline: General Director at Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics & Fries Museum

profile_positions.description: I direct the Museum of Friesland (Fries Museum), the Friesland Resistance Museum and Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics.
profile_positions.title: Director General

company.name: Stichting Museum Jeugd Universiteit (Museum Youth University)

profile_positions.company: Stichting Museum Jeugd Universiteit (Museum Youth University)
profile_positions.description:
Since 2009 many museums in the Netherlands organize twice a year series of lectures for kids from 8 to 12 years old. The lectures' subjects are exciting, special, funny or weird and are related to the topics of each museum. The lecturerers are researchers of the museum, from the academic world, or specialists on the subject.
As member of the board I am responsible for the development 1. of the format to reach a larger and more diverse audience of young people and 2. of the level of learning as well as the engaging quality of the lectures.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
The Zuiderzee Museum as a hybrid maritime and crafts open air museum is a unique place for designers, artists, fashion designers, fotographers and architects to work with an inspiring cultural historical context and collection. It is a living library with building blocks for tackling contemporary and future challenges involving water, space and people.
For the Fries Museum and Ceramics Museum Princessehof, I continue this connection between heritage as inspiration and designers of solutions for the future.
profile_positions.title: Member

company.name: CODART - Dutch and Flemish art in museums worldwide

profile_positions.company: CODART - Dutch and Flemish art in museums worldwide
profile_positions.description: Connecting the world of research to the world of the public.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for the overall collections strategy and museum programme of the Zuiderzee Museum. I connected collections to communities, history to contemporary developments and material to intangible heritage. I directed the departments of research, registration & conservation, the maritime collection, learning and exhibitions.
profile_positions.title: Head of Collections & Presentations

company.name: ICOM International Committee of Maritime Museums

profile_positions.company: ICOM International Committee of Maritime Museums
profile_positions.description: Together with prominent colleagues such as Mystic Seaport in the USA the Zuiderzee Museum is proud to be an open air member of the global network of maritime museums. The Zuiderzee Museum ads to the network its contemporary collaboration with creative industries.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description: I adviced the NWO on the societal values of research projects concerning creative industries and cultural heritage.
profile_positions.title: Advisor creative industry & cultural heritage

company.name: ICOM International Committee on Exhibitions and Exchange

profile_positions.company: ICOM International Committee on Exhibitions and Exchange
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
I directed exhibitions about art and history at the Rijksmuseum, in The Netherlands and abroad.
Highlights: Fire! Jan van der Heijden (2007), Held. Rijksmuseum in the Nieuwe Kerk (2007), Karel du Jardin (2007), 12 Years of Acquisitions - Ronald de Leeuw (2008), For the Love of God. Damien Hirst in the Rijksmuseum (2008), The Hague School. Masterpieces from the Rijksmuseum (Vigo, A Coruña, 2009), Hendrick Avercamp (2009), Document Nederland (2008: Huis Marseille).
profile_positions.title: Curator of Exhibitions
